Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2014 10:05AM DoxieMomof3 wrote: Hello, I haven't posted much, but I have been following this thread, and I so felt the same way about the end of treatment.¬† So lost :(¬† and I didn't know how to explain it to my family.¬† I just kind of felt like while I was doing chemo and radiation I was doing something to FIGHT the cancer, but now I just feel like I have no control of the cancer anymore. It makes me feel better knowing that I am not the only person who felt this way!
Posts.Title: Winter 2013-2014 Rads TeamKim mouse9587

Posts.Content: DoxieMomof3 wrote: Hi, I was just wondering if anyone chose to not finish treatment? I have had 3 of my 4 dense dose treatments and this last one nearly ended me up in the hospital and I spent hundreds of dollars trying to figure out why I couldn't catch my breath. In the end they never could tell me what was going on but I am not sure I can go through this one more time. I still have 4 dense doses of Taxtore left after my last AC on Thursday. My tumor was very small no lymph node involvement and I am beginning to feel like the treatment is worse then the disease üòè I talked to my doctor and he said it is totally up to me, that he really can't tell me what the benefits/repercussions are of doing it or not doing it. So have any of you ladies chose not to finish because of the side effects? Thanks and I hope everyone is having a great weekend!! Toni Dx 9/4/2013, IDC, Right, <1cm, Stage IB, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Surgery 9/13/2013 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel Surgery 9/20/2013 Lumpectomy: Right Chemotherapy 10/17/2013 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 11/7/2013 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Dx 12/9/2015, ILC, Right, <1cm, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 12/18/2015 Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left Chemotherapy 1/21/2016 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone stopped AC before finishing all 4? DoxieMomof3 Spookiesmom
